meanings.definition: Of or relating to a primate
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper studied the primatial behavior of the monkeys.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted research on primatial species in the jungle.
meanings.sent3: The primatial antics of the chimpanzees never failed to entertain the visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her primatial instincts kicked in when she saw the banana peel on the floor.
meanings.sent5: The primatial features of the gorilla made it stand out among the other animals.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a primate archbishop or primate of a church
meanings.sent1: The primatial robes worn by the archbishop were elaborate and grand.
meanings.sent2: The primatial duties of the church leader included overseeing important ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The primatial hat of the bishop was so large that it kept falling off his head.
meanings.sent4: Her primatial authority in the church was unquestioned by the parishioners.
meanings.sent5: The primatial residence of the primate was a magnificent palace in the city.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the highest ranking bishop in a province
meanings.sent1: The primatial position of the bishop gave him great influence in the region.
meanings.sent2: The primatial responsibilities of the bishop included leading important ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The primatial staff of the bishop was adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent4: Her primatial presence commanded respect from all clergy members.
meanings.sent5: The primatial cathedral where the bishop resided was a symbol of power and faith.
